item.title: Nothing Gold Can Stay
item.description: Nature’s first green is gold, Her hardest hue to hold. Her early leaf’s a flower; But only so an hour. The leaf subsides to leaf. So Eden sank to grief, So dawn goes down to day, Nothing gold can stay. Robert Frost, (“Nothing Gold Can Stay (Poem)” 2022) References .csl-entry{text-indent: -1.5em; margin-left: 1.5em;}“Nothing Gold Can Stay (Poem).” 2022. item.title: The Riddle of Strider
item.description: All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost. From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king. J. R. R. Tolkien, (Tolkien 2012) References .csl-entry{text-indent: -1.5em; margin-left: 1.5em;}Tolkien, J.

item.title: Sara Teasdale | There Will Come Soft Rains (Poem)
Emily Dickinson | "Hope" is the thing with feathers
item.description: “Hope” is the thing with feathers - That perches in the soul - And sings the tune without the words - And never stops - at all - And sweetest - in the Gale - is heard - And sore must be the storm - That could abash the little Bird That kept so many warm - I’ve heard it in the chillest land - And on the strangest Sea -

item.title: Emily Dickinson | Tell all the truth but tell it slant
item.description: Tell all the truth but tell it slant — Success in Circuit lies Too bright for our infirm Delight The Truth’s superb surprise As Lightning to the Children eased With explanation kind The Truth must dazzle gradually Or every man be blind — Emily Dickinson, (Dickinson 2022) References .csl-entry{text-indent: -1.5em; margin-left: 1.5em;}Dickinson, Emily. 2022. “Tell All the Truth but Tell It Slant.” Text/Html. item.title: Footnote to Howl
item.description: Holy! Holy! Holy! Holy! Holy! Holy! Holy! Holy! Holy! Holy! Holy! Holy! Holy! Holy! Holy! The world is holy! The soul is holy! The skin is holy! The nose is holy! The tongue and cock and hand and asshole holy! Everything is holy! everybody’s holy! everywhere is holy! everyday is in eternity! Everyman’s an angel! The bum’s as holy as the seraphim! the madman is holy as you my soul are holy!

item.title: Percy Bysshe Shelley | Ozymandias
item.description: I met a traveller from an antique land Who said: “Two vast and trunkless legs of stone Stand in the desert. Near them, on the sand, Half sunk, a shattered visage lies, whose frown, And wrinkled lip, and sneer of cold command, Tell that its sculptor well those passions read Which yet survive, stamped on these lifeless things, The hand that mocked them and the heart that fed: And on the pedestal these words appear:

item.title: Litany Against Fear
item.description: I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer. Fear is the little-death that brings total obliteration. I will face my fear. I will permit it to pass over me and through me. And when it has gone past I will turn the inner eye to see its path. Where the fear has gone there will be nothing. Only I will remain. Bene Gesserit, Herbert | Dune
